answers.answer: Ask for a referral to a fertility specialist or a perinatologist.  The diabetes merits such a referral even if the cyst doesn't.  I think removing a cyst from an ovary will have NO bearing on getting pregnant except possibly to make it more likely.  But the diabetes might have a bearing on the issue.

question: I been trying to get pregnant after doctors removed the cyst i had in one of my ovaries but i havent had no luck.They removed it in 2003 and since then i been trying to have a baby.Since then a year later i got diabetic could that be one of the cause of not getting pregnant?could the cyst cause me not to have a baby?What could i tell my doctor to help have a baby?
title: Could i get pregnant after doctors removed a cyst from one of my ovaries?
